option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# AI-Powered Development: A Day in the Future ## 3-Minute Hackathon Presentation
---
## Slide 1: Title **AI-Powered Development: Building with Copilot & MCP**
*A Hackathon Journey into AI-Assisted Software Engineering*
**Presenter:** [Your Name] **Date:** November 28, 2025
---
## Slide 2: The Challenge **Goal:** Build a full-stack task management system in ONE day using AI tools
**Tech Stack:** - ✅ Spring Boot 3.5.5 Backend (Java) - ✅ MCP Server Implementation - ✅ Angular UI Frontend - ✅ GitHub Integration - ✅ Full CRUD Operations
**The Twist:** Use AI for EVERYTHING possible
---
## Slide 3: AI Tools Arsenal **GitHub Copilot - Multiple Modes:**
1. ** Plan Mode** - Brainstorming & Architecture 2. ** Agent Mode** - Code Generation (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini) 3. ** Chat Mode** - Problem Solving & Debugging
**MCP Servers:** - **GitHub MCP** - Automated repo creation, PRs, commits - **Atlassian MCP** - Integrated documentation - **Custom MCP** - Task management tools (built today!)
---
## Slide 4: The Journey - Act I: Planning **Started with Copilot Plan Mode**
- Brainstormed architecture patterns - Defined MCP server integration strategy - Mapped out project structure
**Result:** Clear roadmap in minutes vs. hours
**Key Learning:** AI excels at structured planning when given context
---
## Slide 5: The Journey - Act II: Building **GitHub MCP Server Magic**
``` ✅ Created GitHub repository ✅ Initialized project structure ✅ Committed initial code ✅ Created branches & PRs ```
All through natural language commands!
**Copilot Agent Mode:** - Generated 4 controllers - Built 11 MCP tools - Created REST APIs - Added validation & error handling
**Felt like:** A conductor orchestrating, not a coder typing
---
## Slide 6: The Journey - Act III: MCP Server **Built Production-Grade MCP Server**
**Capabilities Implemented:** - **11 Tools** - Project & task CRUD operations - **3 Prompts** - AI-assisted summaries & planning - **4 Resources** - Direct data access - **SSE Transport** - Real-time streaming
**Architecture:** Based on dvaas pattern, adapted for task management
**Lines of Code:** ~2000+ (mostly AI-generated)
---
## Slide 7: What Worked Brilliantly ** The Wins:**
✅ **Speed:** 8-hour project done in 4-5 hours ✅ **Code Quality:** Best practices built-in ✅ **Learning:** Explored 3 different AI models ✅ **Integration:** GitHub workflow fully automated ✅ **Documentation:** AI generated comprehensive docs
**Best Moment:** Watching AI create PR, commit, and document changes autonomously
---
## Slide 8: The Challenges **⚠️ The Reality Check:**
❌ **Non-Deterministic:** AI suggestions varied run-to-run ❌ **Context Loss:** Easy to lose track of changes ❌ **Over-Correction:** AI sometimes "fixed" working code ❌ **MCP Integration:** Couldn't fully integrate custom MCP into Copilot ❌ **Steering Required:** Constant guidance needed to stay on track
**Learning:** AI is a powerful assistant, not autopilot (yet)
---
## Slide 9: The "I'm Just Approving" Feeling **Emotional Rollercoaster:**
**Exciting:** "Wow, it wrote 200 lines in seconds!" **Unsettling:** "Am I even coding anymore?" **Challenging:** "Wait, what did it just change?" **Humbling:** "I'm basically a project manager now"
**Reality:** Still needed deep technical knowledge to: - Validate AI suggestions - Debug integration issues - Architect the solution - Keep the vision coherent
---
## Slide 10: Technical Deep Dive **MCP Server Architecture:**
``` ┌─────────────────┐ │ Angular UI │ ← User Interface └────────┬────────┘ │ HTTP/REST ┌────────▼────────┐ │ Spring Boot │ ← Business Logic │ Controllers │ └────────┬────────┘ │ ┌────┴────┐ │ │ ┌───▼──┐ ┌──▼───┐ │ REST │ │ MCP │ ← Two Interfaces │ API │ │ SSE │ │:8080 │ │:8081 │ └──────┘ └──────┘ ```
**Key Feature:** Single app, dual interface - traditional REST + AI-native MCP
---
## Slide 11: By The Numbers **Hackathon Stats:**
- **⏱️ Time Spent:** ~6 hours - ** Lines Written:** ~2,500+ - ** AI-Generated:** ~85% - ** Manual Fixes:** ~15% - ** Iterations:** Lost count (many!) - **☕ Coffee Consumed:** 4 cups - ** Features Shipped:** 15+ - ** Bugs Created by AI:** 7 - ** Bugs Fixed by AI:** 12
**ROI:** 3-4x faster than traditional coding
---
## Slide 12: Live Demo **What I'll Show:**
1. **Angular UI** - Create project & tasks 2. **REST API** - Traditional backend calls 3. **MCP Server** - AI-native interface 4. **GitHub Integration** - Automated workflows
**Demo URL:** - Frontend: http://localhost:4200 - Backend: http://localhost:8080 - MCP: http://localhost:8081/mcp/sse
---
## Slide 13: Key Insights **What I Learned About AI-Assisted Development:**
1. **Context is King** - Better context = better output 2. **Iterate Rapidly** - Don't aim for perfection first time 3. **Version Control is Critical** - Easy to lose track of changes 4. **Trust but Verify** - Always review AI suggestions 5. **Multiple Models** - Different AI models have different strengths 6. **MCP is Powerful** - Standard protocol for AI integration is game-changing
---
## Slide 14: The Future is Here **Paradigm Shift in Software Development:**
**Traditional:** - Developer writes every line - Hours on boilerplate - Manual documentation - Sequential development
**AI-Assisted:** - Developer orchestrates & validates - Minutes on structure - Auto-generated docs - Parallel exploration
**New Skill:** Knowing WHAT to build > HOW to code it
---
## Slide 15: What's Next? **Future Improvements:**
**Technical:** - Complete MCP Copilot integration - Add authentication & authorization - Deploy to cloud - Real-time collaboration features
**AI Enhancements:** - Fine-tune prompts for better accuracy - Custom AI models trained on codebase - Automated testing generation - AI code review integration
---
## Slide 16: Call to Action **The Takeaway:**
> "AI didn't replace the developer... > It made me 3x more productive and 10x more exploratory"
**Try it yourself:** - Backend: https://github.com/[your-username]/task-management-backend - Frontend: https://github.com/daniel-ignea/task-management-ui - Full MCP docs included
**Questions?**
---
## Slide 17: Thank You! **Contact & Resources:**
- Email: [your-email] - LinkedIn: [your-profile] - GitHub: [your-github]
**Resources:** - GitHub Copilot Docs - MCP Protocol: modelcontextprotocol.io - Reference Project: github.com/danvega/dvaas
**Special Thanks:** - GitHub Copilot Team - MCP Community - Hackathon Organizers
---
## Presentation Notes & Timing
**Timing Breakdown (3 minutes = 180 seconds):**
- Slides 1-2: **Introduction** (20 sec) - Slides 3-4: **Tools & Planning** (20 sec) - Slides 5-6: **Building Process** (30 sec) - Slides 7-9: **Wins & Challenges** (40 sec) - Slide 10: **Architecture** (15 sec) - Slide 11: **Numbers** (10 sec) - Slide 12: **Demo** (30 sec) *if time allows* - Slides 13-14: **Insights** (20 sec) - Slide 15-17: **Closing** (15 sec)
**Key Slides to Focus On:** 5, 7, 8, 9, 11, 13
**Energy Points:** - High energy for wins (Slide 7) - Honest about challenges (Slide 8) - Enthusiastic about future (Slide 14)
**Backup Plan:** If running short on time, skip slides 10, 12, 15
---
## Speaker Notes
### Opening Hook (Slide 1-2) *"What if I told you I built a full-stack application with GitHub integration, MCP server, and Angular UI in just one day? And I felt more like a conductor than a coder?"*
### The Journey (Slides 3-6) *"I used GitHub Copilot in three different modes - Plan for architecture, Agent for code generation, and Chat for debugging. But the real magic? The GitHub MCP server created repos, committed code, and managed PRs through natural language."*
### Reality Check (Slides 7-9) *"It wasn't all smooth sailing. AI is non-deterministic - run it twice, get different results. I lost track of changes multiple times and had to restart. But here's the thing: even with the challenges, I was 3-4x faster than traditional coding."*
### Technical Win (Slide 10-11) *"The MCP server is production-ready: 11 tools, SSE transport, following industry patterns. 2,500+ lines of code, 85% AI-generated. And yes, AI created more bugs than it started with, but it also fixed them all."*
### The Big Picture (Slides 13-14) *"This is a paradigm shift. The skill is no longer HOW to code every line, but WHAT to build and how to orchestrate AI to build it. You still need deep technical knowledge, but you use it differently."*
### Closing (Slides 15-17) *"AI didn't replace me. It made me a better, faster, more exploratory developer. The future is here, and it's collaborative."*
---
## Visual Suggestions
**Slide 2:** Screenshots of final application **Slide 3:** Logo grid of AI tools used **Slide 5:** Animated GIF of GitHub MCP creating repo **Slide 7:** Green checkmarks with metrics **Slide 8:** Yellow warning icons with honest text **Slide 10:** Architecture diagram (clean, minimal) **Slide 11:** Infographic with numbers **Slide 14:** Split screen: Traditional vs AI-Assisted
---
## Demo Script (If Time Allows)
**30-Second Demo:**
1. **Show Angular UI** (5 sec) - "Here's the finished product - task management like Jira"
2. **Create a Project** (10 sec) - Click, type "AI Hackathon", create - "AI generated all this UI code"
3. **Show MCP Endpoint** (10 sec) - Open http://localhost:8081/mcp - "This is the AI-native interface - MCP protocol"
4. **Show GitHub Repo** (5 sec) - "Created by AI, committed by AI, documented by AI"
**Backup:** If no demo, use screenshots/video

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# PRESENTATION CHEAT SHEET ## Quick Reference for 3-Minute Pitch
---
## ⏱️ TIME CHECKPOINTS
| Time | Slide | Topic | Key Message | |------|-------|-------|-------------| | 0:00 | 1 | Title | "Built full-stack in ONE day with AI" | | 0:20 | 2-3 | Tools | "3 Copilot modes + MCP servers" | | 0:40 | 4-6 | Journey | "Plan → Build → 2000+ lines AI-generated" | | 1:20 | 7 | Wins | "3-4x faster, best practices built-in" | | 1:40 | 8-9 | Reality | "Non-deterministic, lost track, but still won" | | 2:10 | 10-11 | Insights | "WHAT to build > HOW to code" | | 2:35 | 12-14 | Close | "3x productive, 10x exploratory" |
---
## OPENING LINE (MEMORIZE)
*"What if I told you I built a full-stack task management application with MCP server capabilities, GitHub integration, and Angular UI in just ONE day? And I felt more like a conductor than a coder?"*
---
## CLOSING LINE (MEMORIZE)
*"AI didn't replace the developer. It made me 3x more productive and 10x more exploratory. Questions?"*
---
## KEY STATS (MEMORIZE THESE)
| Stat | Value | Use When... | |------|-------|-------------| | Time | 6 hours (vs 8+) | Talking about speed | | Code | 2,500+ lines | Showing scale | | AI % | 85% | Discussing AI contribution | | Speed | 3-4x faster | Emphasizing productivity | | Tools | 11 MCP tools | Technical achievement | | Bugs | 7 created, 12 fixed | Being honest about challenges |
---
## MUST-MENTION POINTS
### ✅ Technical Achievements - [ ] Spring Boot 3.5.5 with MCP server - [ ] 11 MCP tools with SSE transport - [ ] Angular UI frontend - [ ] GitHub MCP automated workflow - [ ] 2,500+ lines in 6 hours
### ✅ AI Usage - [ ] Plan Mode for architecture - [ ] Agent Mode for code gen (3 models) - [ ] Chat Mode for debugging - [ ] GitHub MCP for repo management - [ ] 85% AI-generated code
### ✅ Honest Challenges - [ ] Non-deterministic results - [ ] Context loss - [ ] Constant steering needed - [ ] "Am I even coding?" feeling - [ ] Still needed deep knowledge
### ✅ Key Insight - [ ] Paradigm shift: WHAT > HOW - [ ] 3-4x productivity gain - [ ] AI amplifies, doesn't replace - [ ] Context is king - [ ] Trust but verify
---
## ENERGY LEVELS
``` Energy High ████████░░░░░░░░░░░░ Opening (Hook them!) Energy High ██████████████░░░░░░ Wins (Excitement!) Energy Mid ████████████░░░░░░░░ Challenges (Honest) Energy High ██████████████████░░ Insights (Inspiring) Energy High ████████████████████ Closing (Memorable!) ```
---
## IF RUNNING OVER TIME
**2:45 - SKIP TO CLOSING** "Let me jump to the key insight: AI didn't replace me, it made me 3x more productive..."
**2:30 - CUT CHALLENGES SHORT** "While I faced non-deterministic results and context loss, the bottom line is..."
**2:00 - EMERGENCY CONDENSE** "Built full-stack in 6 hours, 3-4x faster, 85% AI-generated, still needed my expertise. The paradigm is shifting from HOW to WHAT. AI amplifies developers. Questions?"
---
## IF RUNNING UNDER TIME
**1:30 - ADD EMOTIONAL JOURNEY** Expand on "Am I even coding?" feeling
**2:00 - ADD TECHNICAL DETAIL** Mention SSE transport, JSON-RPC 2.0
**2:30 - ADD DEMO** Show running application
---
## TRANSITION PHRASES
**Moving to next topic:** - "So here's what happened..." - "But here's the thing..." - "Let's talk about reality..." - "The real insight here is..."
**Emphasizing a point:** - "And this is key..." - "Here's what's important..." - "This is the game-changer..."
**Being honest:** - "Let's be real..." - "I won't sugarcoat it..." - "Here's the truth..."
---
## ❓ QUESTION PREP
**Q: Production-ready?** A: "Architecture yes, but needs auth, better error handling, testing"
**Q: AI mistakes?** A: "Yes - 7 bugs created, 12 fixed. Need knowledge to spot issues"
**Q: Biggest limitation?** A: "Context management. AI loses big picture. You guide the vision"
**Q: Your role?** A: "15% coding, 100% architecture & validation. Conductor, not player"
**Q: Would you do it again?** A: "Absolutely. 3-4x faster is game-changing for prototypes"
---
## BODY LANGUAGE
- ✅ Stand tall, confident posture - ✅ Make eye contact with different people - ✅ Use hand gestures for emphasis - ✅ Smile when talking about wins - ✅ Nod during honest challenges - ✅ Pause after key stats
- ❌ Don't fidget - ❌ Don't pace nervously - ❌ Don't read slides - ❌ Don't rush - ❌ Don't apologize
---
## OPENING STRATEGY
**First 10 seconds are CRITICAL**
1. **Pause** (let them settle) 2. **Make eye contact** 3. **Deliver hook with confidence** 4. **Pause again** (let it land) 5. **Smile** 6. **Continue with energy**
---
## CLOSING STRATEGY
**Last 15 seconds are MEMORABLE**
1. **Slow down slightly** 2. **Deliver quote with emphasis** - "AI didn't replace the developer..." - **[Pause]** - "It made me 3x more productive..." - **[Pause]** - "...and 10x more exploratory" 3. **Smile** 4. **"Questions?"** 5. **Open body language**
---
## BACKUP SLIDES (if needed)
**If asked for more technical detail:** - Architecture diagram (Slide 10 from full deck) - Code samples (have GitHub ready) - MCP protocol explanation
**If asked about frontend:** - Angular UI screenshots - Integration with backend - User workflow demo
**If asked about future:** - Authentication plans - Cloud deployment - AI enhancements
---
## ✅ PRE-PRESENTATION RITUAL
**5 minutes before:** - [ ] Deep breath x3 - [ ] Review opening line - [ ] Review closing line - [ ] Review key stats - [ ] Glass of water - [ ] Confident posture - [ ] Smile
**1 minute before:** - [ ] Phone on silent - [ ] Slides ready, slide 1 showing - [ ] Timer ready - [ ] Another deep breath - [ ] "I've got this"
---
## SUCCESS DEFINITION
**You've won if they remember:**
1. ✅ You built impressive full-stack app in ONE day 2. ✅ It was 3-4x faster with AI 3. ✅ You were honest about challenges 4. ✅ Paradigm is shifting (WHAT > HOW) 5. ✅ AI amplifies, doesn't replace
**Bonus win if they think:** - "That was inspiring" - "I want to try this" - "Very honest and realistic" - "Great technical achievement"
---
## CONFIDENCE BOOSTERS
**Remember:** - You DID build something impressive - You DID learn cutting-edge tech - You ARE ahead of the curve - Your honesty IS a strength - Your insight IS valuable
**You've got this!**
---
## FINAL CHECKLIST
**Technical:** - [ ] PowerPoint loaded: `AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx` - [ ] Apps running (if demoing): 8080, 4200, 8081 - [ ] Timer set: 3:00 minutes - [ ] This cheat sheet printed or on phone
**Mental:** - [ ] Opening line memorized - [ ] Closing line memorized - [ ] Key stats memorized - [ ] Practiced at least 2x - [ ] Feeling confident
**Physical:** - [ ] Water bottle nearby - [ ] Phone silenced - [ ] Comfortable stance - [ ] Ready to rock
---
## WHEN YOUR NAME IS CALLED
1. **Walk confidently to front** 2. **Thank the organizers** 3. **Position yourself center stage** 4. **Make eye contact with audience** 5. **Deep breath** 6. **Launch with the hook** 7. **Crush it!**
---
**Remember: You're not just presenting a project. You're sharing a glimpse of the future of development.**
**GO GET 'EM!** ✨

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# Hackathon Presentation Materials
## What's Included
This folder contains everything you need for your 3-minute hackathon presentation:
### Main Presentation - **`AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx`** - Ready-to-present PowerPoint (14 slides) - Professional design - Optimized for 3-minute delivery - Clear, crisp visuals - Key stats highlighted
### Supporting Documents
1. **`PRESENTATION_SCRIPT.md`** - Complete word-for-word script - Timed sections (with timestamps) - What to say for each slide - Energy level guidance - Emergency backup plans
2. **`PRESENTATION_CHEAT_SHEET.md`** - Quick reference card - Key stats to memorize - Opening/closing lines - Time checkpoints - Question prep - Print this out!
3. **`PROJECT_SUMMARY.md`** - One-page technical summary - Comprehensive overview - Architecture diagram - Stats and metrics - Can be used as handout
4. **`HACKATHON_PRESENTATION.md`** - Full detailed slides - 17 slides with speaker notes - Extended content for reference - Visual suggestions - Timing breakdown
### ️ Generation Script - **`create_presentation.py`** - Python script that generated the PowerPoint - Uses python-pptx library - Customizable if you need changes
---
## Quick Start
### Option 1: Just Present (Easiest) 1. Open `AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx` 2. Read `PRESENTATION_CHEAT_SHEET.md` (5 min review) 3. Practice once with timer 4. You're ready!
### Option 2: Prepare Thoroughly 1. Read `PRESENTATION_SCRIPT.md` fully (10 min) 2. Open `AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx` 3. Practice with script 2-3 times 4. Print `PRESENTATION_CHEAT_SHEET.md` to bring with you 5. Memorize opening and closing lines 6. Crush it!
### Option 3: Deep Dive 1. Review all materials (30 min) 2. Practice 3+ times 3. Record yourself and review 4. Adjust timing as needed 5. Print cheat sheet 6. Dominate!
---
## ⏱️ Presentation Structure (3 minutes)
| Time | Section | Slides | Focus | |------|---------|--------|-------| | 0:00-0:20 | Opening | 1-2 | Hook them! | | 0:20-0:40 | Tools | 3-4 | Show your arsenal | | 0:40-1:20 | Journey | 5-6 | Tell the story | | 1:20-1:40 | Wins | 7 | Celebrate success | | 1:40-2:10 | Reality | 8-9 | Be honest | | 2:10-2:35 | Insights | 10-11 | Share wisdom | | 2:35-3:00 | Close | 12-14 | Leave them inspired |
---
## Key Messages (Must Communicate)
### Primary Message **"I built a full-stack application in one day using AI, achieving 3-4x productivity gain"**
### Secondary Messages 1. Used multiple AI tools effectively (Copilot, MCP) 2. 85% AI-generated code, but still needed expertise 3. Honest about challenges (non-deterministic, context loss) 4. Paradigm shift: WHAT to build > HOW to code 5. AI amplifies developers, doesn't replace them
### Emotional Arc Start → Exciting → Challenging → Insightful → Inspiring
---
## What Makes This Presentation Strong
### ✅ Strengths
1. **Honest & Authentic** - Acknowledges both wins and challenges - "Am I even coding?" resonates - Builds credibility
2. **Technical & Impressive** - 2,500+ lines of code - 11 MCP tools built - Spring Boot 3.5.5 + Angular - Production-ready architecture
3. **Forward-Looking** - Explores paradigm shift - Insights about future of development - Inspiring for audience
4. **Well-Structured** - Clear beginning, middle, end - Logical flow - Memorable closing quote
5. **Relatable** - Other developers can connect - Real challenges discussed - Practical insights
---
## Slide Breakdown
### Slide 1: Title - **Purpose:** First impression - **Duration:** 10 sec - **Energy:** High - **Key:** Confident delivery
### Slide 2: The Challenge - **Purpose:** Set the scope - **Duration:** 10 sec - **Key:** Show ambition
### Slide 3: AI Tools Arsenal - **Purpose:** Show your toolset - **Duration:** 20 sec - **Key:** Multiple tools = sophisticated approach
### Slide 4: Act I - Planning - **Purpose:** Journey begins - **Duration:** 15 sec - **Key:** Fast planning with AI
### Slide 5: Act II - Building - **Purpose:** The magic moment - **Duration:** 25 sec - **Key:** GitHub MCP automation + code generation
### Slide 6: Act III - MCP Server - **Purpose:** Technical achievement - **Duration:** 15 sec - **Key:** 11 tools, production-ready
### Slide 7: What Worked - **Purpose:** Celebrate wins - **Duration:** 20 sec - **Energy:** HIGH - **Key:** 3-4x faster
### Slide 8: The Reality Check - **Purpose:** Honest challenges - **Duration:** 20 sec - **Key:** Non-deterministic, context loss
### Slide 9: The "Just Approving" Feeling - **Purpose:** Emotional truth - **Duration:** 20 sec - **Key:** Relatable experience
### Slide 10: By The Numbers - **Purpose:** Hard data - **Duration:** 10 sec - **Key:** 85% AI-generated
### Slide 11: Key Insights - **Purpose:** Share wisdom - **Duration:** 20 sec - **Key:** Context is king
### Slide 12: The Paradigm Shift - **Purpose:** Big picture - **Duration:** 15 sec - **Key:** WHAT > HOW
### Slide 13: What's Next - **Purpose:** Future vision - **Duration:** 10 sec - **Key:** This is just the beginning
### Slide 14: The Takeaway - **Purpose:** Memorable closing - **Duration:** 15 sec - **Energy:** HIGH - **Key:** The quote
---
## Delivery Tips
### Voice - **Vary your pace** - slow for emphasis, faster for excitement - **Pause strategically** - let key stats sink in - **Volume up for wins** - show enthusiasm - **Confident tone** - you built something impressive
### Body Language - **Stand tall** - confident posture - **Eye contact** - connect with different people - **Hand gestures** - emphasize key points - **Don't pace** - stay relatively still - **Smile** - especially during wins
### Timing - **Don't rush** - 3 minutes is longer than you think - **Watch for 2-minute mark** - prepare to wrap up - **Have slide number visible** - know where you are - **Practice with timer** - muscle memory for pacing
---
## Common Pitfalls to Avoid
### ❌ Don't Do This
1. **Read slides word-for-word** - boring! 2. **Apologize or be negative** - "sorry this isn't..." 3. **Go over time** - respect the limit 4. **Focus only on tech** - tell the story 5. **Skip the challenges** - honesty builds trust 6. **Rush through** - pace yourself 7. **Hide behind slides** - engage with audience
### ✅ Do This Instead
1. **Use slides as prompts** - tell the story 2. **Be confident** - you did great work 3. **End exactly on time** - shows preparation 4. **Balance tech with story** - journey narrative 5. **Be honest about struggles** - relatable 6. **Take your time** - clear, measured delivery 7. **Connect with people** - eye contact, smile
---
## Tech Setup
### If Presenting In-Person
**Before You Start:** - [ ] Load PowerPoint on presentation computer - [ ] Verify slides display correctly - [ ] Test clicker/remote (if available) - [ ] Know how to advance slides - [ ] Set slide show to start from beginning
**Backup Plan:** - Have PDF version on USB drive - Have slides on phone (just in case) - Know content well enough to present without slides
### If Presenting Virtual
**Before You Start:** - [ ] Test screen sharing - [ ] Close unnecessary windows/tabs - [ ] Turn off notifications - [ ] Check audio/video - [ ] Have slides ready, first slide showing - [ ] Test timer in separate window
**Backup Plan:** - Have backup internet connection - Have phone ready for audio backup - Have presentation file in cloud (Google Drive, etc.)
---
## ❓ Handling Q&A
### Expected Questions
**Q: "Would you use this in production?"** ✅ "The architecture is production-ready - follows industry patterns like dvaas. Would need to add authentication, more robust error handling, and comprehensive testing. But the foundation is solid."
**Q: "Did AI make mistakes?"** ✅ "Absolutely. AI created 7 bugs and fixed 12 total. The key is having the technical knowledge to spot issues quickly and guide corrections. You still need expertise."
**Q: "What's the biggest limitation?"** ✅ "Context management. AI can lose track of the bigger picture, especially in complex changes. You need strong architectural vision to keep everything coherent."
**Q: "How much did you actually code yourself?"** ✅ "About 15% manual coding - integration fixes, configuration tweaking, validation. But 100% of the architecture decisions and problem-solving were mine. I'm the conductor, AI is the orchestra."
**Q: "Which AI model was best?"** ✅ "Each has strengths. GPT-4 for architecture, Claude for detailed explanations, Gemini for rapid iteration. Using multiple models gave me the best results."
**Q: "Would this work for legacy code?"** ✅ "For greenfield projects and prototypes, absolutely - that's where AI shines. For complex legacy systems, AI is better for specific features than full rewrites. You still need deep understanding of the existing system."
**Q: "What surprised you most?"** ✅ "Two things: First, how FAST you can build with AI - 3-4x is real. Second, the emotional shift - feeling less like a coder and more like an architect/conductor. It's a different skill set."
---
## Success Metrics
### You've Succeeded If...
**Audience Remembers:** 1. ✅ You built something impressive in ONE day 2. ✅ 3-4x productivity gain with AI 3. ✅ Honest about both wins and challenges 4. ✅ Paradigm shift from HOW to WHAT 5. ✅ AI amplifies, doesn't replace
**Judges/Audience Thinks:** - "That was impressive and realistic" - "I want to try AI-assisted development" - "Great balance of enthusiasm and honesty" - "Solid technical achievement" - "Clear insights about the future"
**You Feel:** - Confident about delivery - Proud of what you built - Excited to answer questions - Inspired to continue
---
## How to Practice
### Practice Session 1 (15 minutes) 1. Read through script once 2. Open PowerPoint 3. Run through once with slides 4. Note any stumbling points
### Practice Session 2 (15 minutes) 1. Review stumbling points 2. Run through with timer 3. Record yourself (phone video) 4. Watch and critique
### Practice Session 3 (10 minutes) 1. Final run-through with timer 2. Focus on opening and closing 3. Practice without looking at notes 4. You're ready!
### Day-Of Quick Review (5 minutes) 1. Read cheat sheet 2. Memorize opening line 3. Memorize closing line 4. Review key stats 5. Deep breath, you've got this!
---
## Bonus: After the Presentation
### Immediately After - [ ] Thank the audience/judges - [ ] Be ready for 1-2 follow-up questions - [ ] Smile and show confidence - [ ] Note any feedback received
### Following Up - [ ] Upload project to GitHub (if not already) - [ ] Share presentation materials - [ ] Write blog post about experience - [ ] Update LinkedIn with achievement - [ ] Connect with interested attendees
### Leveraging This Experience - [ ] Add to resume: "Built full-stack app with MCP server in 1 day" - [ ] Use as portfolio piece - [ ] Reference in job interviews - [ ] Share insights with team/company - [ ] Continue exploring AI-assisted development
---
## Additional Resources
### If They Want to Learn More
**Your Projects:** - Backend: This repository - Frontend: github.com/daniel-ignea/task-management-ui
**MCP Protocol:** - Official: modelcontextprotocol.io - Reference implementation: github.com/danvega/dvaas
**GitHub Copilot:** - Docs: docs.github.com/copilot - MCP Integration: docs.github.com/copilot/customizing-copilot
**Your Insights:** - Full documentation in MCP_*.md files - Test scripts in test-mcp-*.ps1 files - Configuration examples in mcp-server-config.json
---
## What You Learned
### Technical Skills ✅ Spring Boot 3.5.5 advanced features ✅ MCP protocol implementation ✅ SSE (Server-Sent Events) transport ✅ JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol ✅ Angular integration ✅ GitHub MCP server usage
### AI Skills ✅ Effective prompting techniques ✅ Context management strategies ✅ Multi-model utilization ✅ AI output validation ✅ Iterative development with AI ✅ Debugging AI-generated code
### Soft Skills ✅ Rapid prototyping ✅ Architecture planning ✅ Problem-solving under time pressure ✅ Honest self-assessment ✅ Public speaking/presentation ✅ Managing non-deterministic tools
---
## Final Words
You built something impressive. You explored cutting-edge technology. You learned valuable lessons. You have insights to share.
**This presentation is your story.**
Tell it with: - ✨ **Confidence** - you earned it - **Honesty** - it builds trust - **Enthusiasm** - it's contagious - **Clarity** - keep it focused - ❤️ **Passion** - it shows
**You've got this!**
Now go out there and show them the future of development!
---
## Need Help?
**Last-Minute Issues:** - PowerPoint won't open? Use PROJECT_SUMMARY.md - Forgot key stats? Check PRESENTATION_CHEAT_SHEET.md - Need inspiration? Re-read your own code in src/ - Nervous? Remember: you built this in ONE DAY!
**Remember:** > "The future of development isn't AI replacing developers. > It's AI amplifying what developers can achieve."
**And you just proved it.** ✨
---
*Good luck! You're going to do great!*

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# 3-MINUTE HACKATHON PRESENTATION ## Quick Reference Script
---
## OPENING (0:00-0:20) **[Show Title Slide]**
"Good [morning/afternoon]! What if I told you I built a full-stack task management application with MCP server capabilities, GitHub integration, and an Angular UI in just ONE day? And here's the kicker - I felt more like a conductor orchestrating an AI symphony than a developer writing code line by line."
---
## ️ THE SETUP (0:20-0:40) **[Show AI Tools Slide]**
"My arsenal? GitHub Copilot in three modes: - **Plan Mode** for brainstorming architecture - **Agent Mode** with GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini for code generation - **Chat Mode** for debugging
Plus MCP servers - GitHub MCP automated my entire repo workflow, and I built a custom MCP server for task management."
---
## THE JOURNEY (0:40-1:20) **[Show Building Process Slides]**
"I started with Copilot Plan Mode - got a complete architecture roadmap in minutes instead of hours.
Then the magic happened. The GitHub MCP server: - Created my repository - Initialized the project - Committed code - Managed branches and pull requests
All through natural language!
The Agent mode generated over 2,000 lines of code: - 4 Spring Boot controllers - 11 MCP tools for AI integration - Complete REST APIs - Validation and error handling
85% of my code was AI-generated. I was essentially approving and steering."
---
## ✅ THE WINS (1:20-1:40) **[Show Wins Slide]**
"The results? - **3-4x faster** than traditional development - **Best practices** built-in automatically - Explored **three different AI models** and their strengths - **Fully automated** GitHub workflow - Comprehensive documentation generated automatically
I completed what would take 8 hours in just 4-5 hours."
---
## ⚠️ THE REAL TALK (1:40-2:10) **[Show Challenges Slide]**
"But let's be honest - it wasn't all smooth sailing.
AI is **non-deterministic** - run the same prompt twice, get different results.
I **lost track of changes** multiple times and had to restart.
AI sometimes **'fixed' working code**, creating new bugs.
I couldn't fully integrate my custom MCP server into GitHub Copilot.
And here's the emotional part: I'd watch AI write 200 lines in seconds and think 'Am I even coding anymore?' It was exciting but also unsettling. I felt like a project manager approving pull requests rather than a developer crafting code.
But here's the thing - I still needed deep technical knowledge to validate suggestions, debug integration issues, and keep the vision coherent."
---
## THE INSIGHT (2:10-2:35) **[Show Key Learnings Slide]**
"What I learned: This is a **paradigm shift**.
The valuable skill is no longer HOW to code every line, but WHAT to build and how to orchestrate AI to build it.
Context is king - better context equals better output. Version control is critical - it's easy to lose track. Trust but verify - always review AI suggestions.
Traditional development: write every line, hours on boilerplate. AI-assisted: orchestrate and validate, minutes on structure.
**3-4x productivity gain**, even with the challenges."
---
## CLOSING (2:35-3:00) **[Show Takeaway Slide]**
"So here's my takeaway:
**'AI didn't replace the developer. It made me 3x more productive and 10x more exploratory.'**
I built a production-ready Spring Boot backend with 11 MCP tools, SSE transport, an Angular UI frontend, and full GitHub integration - all in one day.
The code is on GitHub - both the backend and the frontend by Daniel Ignea.
The future of development isn't AI replacing us. It's AI amplifying us.
Questions?"
---
## KEY STATS TO MEMORIZE
- **Time:** 6 hours work time (versus 8+ traditional) - **Code:** 2,500+ lines written - **AI-Generated:** 85% - **Speed:** 3-4x faster - **Tools Built:** 11 MCP tools - **Bugs:** AI created 7, fixed 12 - **Models Used:** 3 (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini)
---
## IF RUNNING SHORT ON TIME
**Cut to 2-minute version:** - Skip emotional rollercoaster details - Condense challenges to 15 seconds - Skip technical architecture deep dive - Go straight from wins to insights to closing
**Cut to 1-minute version:** - Opening + Setup: 20 sec - Wins: 20 sec - Reality check: 10 sec - Closing: 10 sec
---
## ENERGY POINTS
- **HIGH ENERGY:** When talking about wins and speed gains - **HONEST/REFLECTIVE:** During challenges section - **INSPIRING:** During closing takeaway - **CONVERSATIONAL:** Throughout - this is a story, not a lecture
---
## VISUAL AIDS
If showing screen: 1. **Final Angular UI** - show the working app 2. **GitHub Repo** - show AI-created commits 3. **MCP Server Response** - show JSON-RPC output 4. **Stats Dashboard** - if you created one
If no screen sharing: - Use hand gestures for emphasis - Write key numbers on whiteboard if available - Make eye contact with judges/audience
---
## ❓ ANTICIPATED QUESTIONS
**Q: "Would you use this in production?"** A: "The architecture is production-ready, but I'd add authentication, error handling improvements, and more testing. The MCP server follows industry patterns from proven implementations like dvaas."
**Q: "Did AI make mistakes?"** A: "Absolutely. It created 7 bugs and fixed 12. The key is having the knowledge to spot and correct issues quickly."
**Q: "What's the biggest limitation?"** A: "Context management. AI can lose track of the big picture. You need strong architectural vision to keep everything coherent."
**Q: "Would this work for production code?"** A: "For greenfield projects and prototypes, absolutely. For complex legacy systems, AI is better for specific features than full rewrites."
**Q: "How much did you really code yourself?"** A: "About 15% manual coding - mostly integration fixes, configuration tweaking, and validating AI output. But 100% of the architecture decisions and problem-solving."
---
## PRESENTATION TIPS
1. **Start strong** - hook them in first 10 seconds 2. **Use pauses** - let key stats sink in 3. **Show enthusiasm** - your energy is contagious 4. **Be honest** - authenticity about challenges builds credibility 5. **End memorably** - the takeaway quote should land perfectly 6. **Watch the clock** - practice to hit exactly 3:00
---
## ✅ PRE-PRESENTATION CHECKLIST
- [ ] Slides loaded and ready - [ ] Demo apps running (if demoing) - [ ] Backend: http://localhost:8080 - [ ] Frontend: http://localhost:4200 - [ ] MCP: http://localhost:8081/mcp - [ ] Timer set for 3 minutes - [ ] Water nearby - [ ] Notes printed (this document) - [ ] Practiced at least twice - [ ] Know your opening line by heart - [ ] Know your closing line by heart
---
## EMERGENCY BACKUP PLAN
**If demo fails:** "And this, friends, is exactly what I was talking about - non-deterministic results! But let me show you the screenshots..."
**If you go over time:** Jump immediately to closing: "Let me skip to the key insight..."
**If you finish early:** Add the emotional journey: "Let me share what it felt like..."
**If you blank out:** Look at stats slide: "Let me share some numbers that really tell the story..."
---
## SUCCESS METRICS
You've succeeded if audience remembers: 1. ✅ You built a full-stack app in ONE day with AI 2. ✅ It was 3-4x faster than traditional coding 3. ✅ AI is a powerful tool but requires human guidance 4. ✅ The paradigm is shifting from HOW to WHAT 5. ✅ You were honest about both wins and challenges
---
## GOOD LUCK!
Remember: You built something impressive. Tell that story with confidence, honesty, and enthusiasm. The judges want to see innovation AND realistic assessment. You've got both.
**Break a leg!**

Needed expertise" │ │ │ │ Q: Biggest limitation? │ │ A: "Context management. You guide the vision" │ │ │ │ Q: Your role? │ │ A: "15% coding, 100% architecture. I'm the conductor" │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Q's?" │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# AI-POWERED DEVELOPMENT: ONE-PAGE SUMMARY **Hackathon Project - November 28, 2025**
---
## PROJECT OVERVIEW Built a full-stack task management system (backend + frontend + MCP server) in **ONE DAY** using AI-assisted development.
**Stack:** Spring Boot 3.5.5 (Java) • Angular UI • MCP Server • GitHub Integration • H2 Database
---
## AI TOOLS USED
| Tool | Purpose | Impact | |------|---------|--------| | **GitHub Copilot Plan Mode** | Architecture brainstorming | Roadmap in minutes vs hours | | **GitHub Copilot Agent Mode** | Code generation (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini) | 85% of code auto-generated | | **GitHub Copilot Chat Mode** | Debugging & problem-solving | Rapid issue resolution | | **GitHub MCP Server** | Automated repo/PR/commit workflow | Zero manual Git operations | | **Custom MCP Server** | AI-native task management API | 11 tools, 3 prompts, 4 resources |
---
## BY THE NUMBERS
| Metric | Value | Notes | |--------|-------|-------| | **Total Time** | ~6 hours | vs 8+ traditional | | **Lines of Code** | 2,500+ | Backend + config | | **AI-Generated** | 85% | Manual: 15% | | **Speed Gain** | 3-4x | Productivity multiplier | | **MCP Tools Built** | 11 | Full CRUD operations | | **AI Models Tested** | 3 | GPT-4, Claude, Gemini | | **Bugs Created by AI** | 7 | But fixed 12! |
---
## ✅ WHAT WORKED BRILLIANTLY
✨ **Speed** - 4-5 hours for 8-hour project ✨ **Quality** - Best practices automatically included ✨ **Learning** - Explored multiple AI models ✨ **Automation** - GitHub workflow fully automated ✨ **Documentation** - Comprehensive auto-generated docs
**Best Moment:** Watching AI autonomously create repos, commit code, and manage PRs
---
## ⚠️ REALITY CHECK: THE CHALLENGES
❌ **Non-Deterministic** - Same prompt, different results ❌ **Context Loss** - Easy to lose track of changes ❌ **Over-Corrections** - AI "fixed" working code ❌ **Integration Limits** - Couldn't fully integrate custom MCP ❌ **Constant Steering** - AI needed continuous guidance
**Emotional Journey:** Exciting → Unsettling → Challenging → Humbling
*"Am I even coding anymore, or just approving?"*
---
## KEY INSIGHTS
### The Paradigm Shift
| Traditional Development | AI-Assisted Development | |------------------------|-------------------------| | Write every line | Orchestrate & validate | | Hours on boilerplate | Minutes on structure | | Manual documentation | Auto-generated docs | | Sequential development | Parallel exploration |
### Critical Learnings
1. **Context is King** - Better context = better AI output 2. **Iterate Rapidly** - Don't aim for perfection first try 3. **Version Control Critical** - Easy to lose track 4. **Trust but Verify** - Always review AI suggestions 5. **Multiple Models Matter** - Different strengths per model 6. **MCP is Powerful** - Standard protocol for AI integration
### The New Skill
**Knowing WHAT to build > Knowing HOW to code every line**
*Still requires deep technical knowledge for validation, debugging, and architecture*
---
## ️ TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE
``` ┌─────────────────────┐ │ Angular UI │ ← User Interface (Port 4200) │ (task-management) │ └──────────┬──────────┘ │ HTTP/REST ┌──────────▼──────────┐ │ Spring Boot 3.5.5 │ ← Business Logic │ Controllers │ │ • ProjectController│ │ • TaskController │ │ • McpController │ └──────────┬──────────┘ │ ┌────┴─────┐ │ │ ┌─────▼───┐ ┌──▼─────┐ │ REST │ │ MCP │ ← Dual Interface │ API │ │ SSE │ │ :8080 │ │ :8081 │ └─────────┘ └────────┘ │ │ ┌─────▼──────────▼─────┐ │ H2 Database (JPA) │ ← Data Layer └──────────────────────┘ ```
**MCP Server Capabilities:** - **11 Tools** - Full CRUD for projects & tasks - **3 Prompts** - AI-assisted summaries & planning - **4 Resources** - Direct data access (projects, tasks by status) - **SSE Transport** - Real-time streaming (JSON-RPC 2.0)
---
## WHAT'S NEXT
**Technical Improvements:** - Complete MCP GitHub Copilot integration - Add authentication & authorization - Deploy to cloud platform - Real-time collaboration features
**AI Enhancements:** - Fine-tune prompts for better accuracy - Train custom models on codebase - Automated test generation - AI-powered code review
---
## REPOSITORIES
- **Backend:** `task-force/service` (this project) - **Frontend:** `github.com/daniel-ignea/task-management-ui` - **Reference:** `github.com/danvega/dvaas` (MCP pattern)
---
## THE TAKEAWAY
> **"AI didn't replace the developer. > It made me 3x more productive and 10x more exploratory."**
### What This Means
- AI is a **force multiplier**, not a replacement - Still need **deep technical knowledge** for validation & architecture - The role shifts from **writing code** to **orchestrating solutions** - **Rapid prototyping** becomes the new normal - **Context management** is the critical skill
### The Future
Development is evolving from: - Individual craftsmanship → Collaborative orchestration - Line-by-line coding → High-level problem solving - Sequential workflows → Parallel exploration - Manual processes → AI-augmented automation
**The developer who embraces AI amplification will outpace the one who doesn't by 3-4x.**
---
## PRESENTATION TIMING (3 min)
| Section | Time | Key Points | |---------|------|------------| | Opening | 0:00-0:20 | Hook: Built full-stack app in 1 day | | AI Tools | 0:20-0:40 | Copilot modes + MCP servers | | Journey | 0:40-1:20 | Plan → Build → MCP server | | Wins | 1:20-1:40 | 3-4x speed, auto-quality | | Reality | 1:40-2:10 | Honest about challenges | | Insights | 2:10-2:35 | Paradigm shift, key learnings | | Closing | 2:35-3:00 | Takeaway quote + Q&A |
---
## CONTACT
- **Project:** Task Management with MCP Server - **GitHub:** [Your GitHub] - **Email:** [Your Email] - **LinkedIn:** [Your LinkedIn]
---
**Built with:** GitHub Copilot • Spring Boot 3.5.5 • Angular • MCP Protocol • AI Models (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini)
**Hackathon Theme:** Exploring AI Capabilities in Modern Software Development
---
*"The future of development isn't AI replacing developers. It's AI amplifying what developers can achieve."*

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
""" PowerPoint Presentation Generator Script Run this to create the actual PowerPoint file """
from pptx import Presentation from pptx.util import Inches, Pt from pptx.enum.text import PP_ALIGN from pptx.dml.color import RGBColor
# Create presentation prs = Presentation() prs.slide_width = Inches(10) prs.slide_height = Inches(7.5)
def add_title_slide(prs, title, subtitle): slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[0]) slide.shapes.title.text = title slide.placeholders[1].text = subtitle return slide
def add_content_slide(prs, title, content_lines): slide = prs.slides.add_slide(prs.slide_layouts[1]) slide.shapes.title.text = title content = slide.placeholders[1].text_frame content.clear() for line in content_lines: p = content.add_paragraph() p.text = line p.level = 0 if not line.startswith(' ') else 1 p.font.size = Pt(18) if p.level == 0 else Pt(16) return slide
# Slide 1: Title add_title_slide(prs, "AI-Powered Development: Building with Copilot & MCP", "A Hackathon Journey into AI-Assisted Software Engineering\nNovember 28, 2025")
# Slide 2: The Challenge add_content_slide(prs, "The Challenge", [ "Goal: Build full-stack task management in ONE day", "", "✅ Spring Boot 3.5.5 Backend (Java)", "✅ MCP Server Implementation", "✅ Angular UI Frontend", "✅ GitHub Integration", "✅ Full CRUD Operations", "", "The Twist: Use AI for EVERYTHING possible" ])
# Slide 3: AI Tools Arsenal add_content_slide(prs, "AI Tools Arsenal", [ "GitHub Copilot - Multiple Modes:", " Plan Mode - Brainstorming & Architecture", " Agent Mode - Code Generation (GPT-4, Claude, Gemini)", " Chat Mode - Problem Solving & Debugging", "", "MCP Servers:", " GitHub MCP - Automated repo creation, PRs, commits", " Atlassian MCP - Integrated documentation", " Custom MCP - Task management tools (built today!)" ])
# Slide 4: The Journey - Planning add_content_slide(prs, "Act I: Planning with AI", [ "Started with Copilot Plan Mode:", " ✓ Brainstormed architecture patterns", " ✓ Defined MCP server integration", " ✓ Mapped out project structure", "", "Result: Clear roadmap in MINUTES vs. HOURS", "", "Key Learning: AI excels at structured planning" ])
# Slide 5: The Journey - Building add_content_slide(prs, "Act II: Building with GitHub MCP", [ "GitHub MCP Server Magic:", " ✅ Created GitHub repository", " ✅ Initialized project structure", " ✅ Committed initial code", " ✅ Created branches & PRs", "", "Copilot Agent Mode generated:", " • 4 controllers • 11 MCP tools", " • REST APIs • Validation & error handling", "", "Felt like: A conductor, not a coder" ])
# Slide 6: MCP Server Built add_content_slide(prs, "Act III: MCP Server Implementation", [ "Built Production-Grade MCP Server:", "", " 11 Tools - Project & task CRUD", " 3 Prompts - AI summaries & planning", " 4 Resources - Direct data access", " SSE Transport - Real-time streaming", "", "~2000+ lines of code (85% AI-generated)", "Based on dvaas pattern, adapted for tasks" ])
# Slide 7: What Worked add_content_slide(prs, "What Worked Brilliantly ✨", [ " The Wins:", "", "✅ Speed: 8-hour project done in 4-5 hours", "✅ Code Quality: Best practices built-in", "✅ Learning: Explored 3 AI models", "✅ Integration: GitHub workflow automated", "✅ Documentation: Comprehensive auto-docs", "", "Best Moment: AI creating PRs autonomously" ])
# Slide 8: The Challenges add_content_slide(prs, "The Reality Check ⚠️", [ "The Challenges:", "", "❌ Non-Deterministic: Varied results per run", "❌ Context Loss: Easy to lose track", "❌ Over-Correction: AI 'fixed' working code", "❌ MCP Integration: Couldn't fully integrate", "❌ Steering Required: Constant guidance needed", "", "AI is a powerful assistant, not autopilot (yet)" ])
# Slide 9: The Feeling add_content_slide(prs, "The 'Just Approving' Feeling", [ "Emotional Rollercoaster:", "", " Exciting: '200 lines in seconds!'", " Unsettling: 'Am I even coding?'", " Challenging: 'What did it change?'", " Humbling: 'I'm a project manager now'", "", "Reality: Still needed deep technical knowledge", " • Validate suggestions • Debug issues", " • Architect solution • Keep vision coherent" ])
# Slide 10: By The Numbers add_content_slide(prs, "By The Numbers ", [ "Hackathon Stats:", "", "⏱️ Time Spent: ~6 hours", " Lines Written: ~2,500+", " AI-Generated: ~85%", " Manual Fixes: ~15%", " Bugs Created by AI: 7", " Bugs Fixed by AI: 12", "", "ROI: 3-4x faster than traditional coding" ])
# Slide 11: Key Insights add_content_slide(prs, "Key Insights ", [ "What I Learned:", "", "1. Context is King - Better input = better output", "2. Iterate Rapidly - Don't aim for perfection", "3. Version Control is Critical - Track changes", "4. Trust but Verify - Always review AI output", "5. Multiple Models - Different strengths", "6. MCP is Powerful - Standard AI protocol", "", "The skill: Knowing WHAT to build > HOW to code" ])
# Slide 12: The Paradigm Shift add_content_slide(prs, "The Future is Here ", [ "Paradigm Shift in Development:", "", "Traditional → AI-Assisted", " Write every line → Orchestrate & validate", " Hours on boilerplate → Minutes on structure", " Manual documentation → Auto-generated", " Sequential development → Parallel exploration", "", "New Skill: Knowing WHAT > HOW" ])
# Slide 13: What's Next add_content_slide(prs, "What's Next? ", [ "Future Improvements:", "", "Technical:", " • Complete MCP Copilot integration", " • Add authentication & authorization", " • Deploy to cloud", "", "AI Enhancements:", " • Fine-tune prompts for accuracy", " • Custom models on codebase", " • Automated test generation" ])
# Slide 14: Closing add_content_slide(prs, "The Takeaway", [ "", "", "\"AI didn't replace the developer...", "", "It made me 3x more productive", "", "and 10x more exploratory\"", "", "", "Questions?" ])
# Save presentation prs.save('AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx') print("✅ PowerPoint created: AI_Hackathon_Presentation.pptx")
